head.title: A Shoe Giant Steps Out On the Upper West Side

hedline.hl1: A Shoe Giant Steps Out On the Upper West Side

abstract.p: Naturalizer Shoes opens store on Columbus Avenue near 66th Street (New Yorkers & Co column) (S)

block.p: Naturalizer Shoes, one of the largest shoe companies in the country, with stores in virtually every state, has opened a New York location, at 148 Columbus Avenue (near 66th Street).

The Manhattan store is part of the company's effort to appeal to younger women, and like all Naturalizer stores, specializes in comfort. ''All women want comfortable shoes,'' said Alicia Noone, manager of the store, which opened early this month. ''Our staff knows how to do just about everything to make a shoe fit.''

The Manhattan store is part of the company's effort to appeal to younger women, and like all Naturalizer stores, specializes in comfort. Models include Bella, a high-heeled dress shoe ($56), and Affton ($60), a clog that, the catalog says, ''makes weekends a little less hectic, because you won't have to think twice about what shoes to wear.''
